The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand in Sarajevo: If I could change one historical event, I would prevent the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand in Sarajevo in 1914. This event is widely considered to be the catalyst for World War I, and preventing it would have had a significant impact on the course of history. The world would be a very different place today if the war had never occurred, and there would be many fewer casualties and less destruction.

The invention of the printing press: If I could change one historical event, I would invent the printing press earlier. The printing press revolutionized the way information was disseminated and made books and other printed materials more widely available to the general public. This would have had a profound impact on education, religion, and politics, and would have made it easier for people to access knowledge and ideas.

The discovery of penicillin: If I could change one historical event, I would discover penicillin earlier. Penicillin is a powerful antibiotic that has saved countless lives since its discovery in the 1920s. If it had been discovered earlier, it could have been used to treat many of the diseases that killed people in the past, and would have greatly improved public health.

The invention of the internet: If I could change one historical event, I would invent the internet earlier. The internet has revolutionized the way we communicate, access information, and conduct business, and has had a profound impact on nearly every aspect of modern life. If it had been invented earlier, it would have made it easier for people to connect with each other and share information, and would have greatly improved the way we live and work.

The discovery of electricity: If I could change one historical event, I would discover electricity earlier. Electricity is a fundamental force of nature that has been harnessed for thousands of years, and its discovery has had a profound impact on human civilization. If it had been discovered earlier, it would have made it easier for people to light their homes, power their machines, and communicate with each other, and would have greatly improved the way we live and work.
